awd_titl_txt: Young Scholars' Summer Mathematics Program at The Ohio StateUniversity
awd_abstract_narration: The Ohio State University will initiate an eight-week,                          residential, Young Scholars project in mathematics for 65                       students entering the 9th through 12th grades.                                                                                                                  This summer program will provide a vivid apprenticeship to a                    life of exploration for mathematically talented students.                       Students are exposed to higher mathematics:  definition,                        theorem, and proof in the spirit of "discovery" through the                     power of intensive involvement.  Daily problem sets are                         directed by lectures, seminar, and student counselors giving                    the students countless hours of tutorial time.  Visits by                       mathematicians and scientists working "in the field" and a                      program library help outline existing career choices and the                    academic backgrounds necessary to make intelligent choices.
org_div_long_name: Division of Research on Learning in Formal and Informal Settings (DRL)
